publish.backend.plugin¶

Plug-in system

Works similar to how OSs look for executables; i.e. a number of absolute paths are searched for a given match. The predicate for executables is whether or not an extension matches a number of options, such as ”.exe” or ”.bat”.

In this system, the predicate is whether or not a fname starts with “validate_” and ends with ”.py”

publish.backend.plugin.patterns¶

Regular expressions used for lookup of plugins.

publish.backend.plugin.registered_paths¶

Set of all registered_paths plugin-paths

class publish.backend.plugin.Filter[source]¶

Abstract base-class for plugins

hosts¶

Hosts compatible with filter

version¶

Current version of filter

class publish.backend.plugin.Context[source]¶

Maintain a collection of Instances

class publish.backend.plugin.Instance(name)[source]¶

An individually publishable component within scene

Examples include rigs, models.

name¶

str

Name of instance, used in plugins

config¶

dict

Full configuration, as recorded onto objectSet.

class publish.backend.plugin.Selector[source]¶

Parse a given working scene for available Instances

class publish.backend.plugin.Validator[source]¶

Validate/check/test individual instance for correctness.

Raises exception upon failure.

class publish.backend.plugin.Extractor[source]¶

Physically separate Instance from Host into corresponding Resources

Yields:(Instance, Exception): Output path and exception
class publish.backend.plugin.Conform[source]¶
publish.backend.plugin.plugins_by_instance(plugins, instance)[source]¶

Yield compatible plugins plugins to instance instance

Parameters:
  • instance (Instance) – Instance with which to filter against
  • plugins (list) – List of plugins
Returns:

List of non-instantiated plugins.
